website_summaries.verdict: The pump handle on this backpack sprayer easily accommodates both right- and left-handed users.
pros: Piston pump handles up to 90 psi
Commercial shutoff valve minimizes user fatigue
Nylon-reinforced, high-pressure hose has extended reach
4 nozzles for a variety of jobs

customer_reviews.title: Poor purchase!
customer_reviews.text: The solo sprayer I purchased leaked profusely right out of the box. The one thing I didn't need was something else to work on. The shoulder straps keep slipping off while I was trying to spray. If your looking for a project or want to be drenched with poison while your new sprayer is slipping to the ground, this sprayer might be for you.
customer_reviews.author: scrike

customer_reviews.title: Terrific investment
customer_reviews.text: Terrific purchase to use with my Bugslayer Box elder spray. So glad we took the plunge and bought this. It makes spraying around your house so easy! Word of caution: only use one type of spray in it - for instance, if you use this for Round-up weed killer in your garden, only use it for that. Buy a separate sprayer for other germicides/pesticides. Even if you rinse it out really well, some residue is always left behind and it's very dangerous to mix things.
customer_reviews.author: Sclaus4

customer_reviews.title: Not even suitable for Harry Homeowner
customer_reviews.text: The first one I bought blew a seal in the pump after about 5 hours of use. It had been more than 30 days, so I had to purchase a second unit, which leaked all over me first time out. I replaced that one with another one that leaked, right out of the box. These are pieces of junk, even for the budget price. Sometimes you don't even get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Requires constant pumping to get even a little spraying done
customer_reviews.text: Sprayer, purchased April 9, 2019, won't build up pressure. Requires constant pumping to get even a little spraying done. Has been that way right out of the box. In addition, the rubber o-ring on the top cap is so loose it falls off when the cap is removed. Hard to put the cap on with the o-ring positioned correctly. Had a previous solo backpack sprayer for years without any problems. This one is a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: no pressure
customer_reviews.text: I always use solo sprayers, have own 12 or more in my life time, I am 73 years old this is the sorry sprayer I have ever own, when I order it from amazon it stated pressure up to 90 but they is no adjustment on it you can pump yourself to death and still do not have any pressure, possible need a different brand after all these years very not happy
customer_reviews.author: lloyd harrelson

customer_reviews.title: Made In The USA !
customer_reviews.text: Always worth it to buy American made products. Quality is always a priority not making it the cheapest. This sprayer is no exception to that. Replaced a Chinese made piece of junk with this backpack sprayer. Great product, good price and buying them helps me do my part to support American small business and their families like we all should. Do yourself a favor and choose this over the cheaper foreign made JUNK
customer_reviews.author: Joni B

customer_reviews.title: Good sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: Solo sprayers have always been an industry standard. I’ve had them in the past and then two seasons ago I spent about $130.00 on a more expensive Stihl brand sprayer. I had two different parts on the Stihl spray wand break in less than two years and I do not misuse my equipment and am not using these sprayers everyday like commercial users. Long story short, I will NEVER by a Stihl sprayer again. I love stihl’s Chainsaws and blowers but their sprayers are garbage and quite expensive. Save your money and go with this Solo sprayer. They’ve been in the game for a long time and are solid sprayers.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: leaks
customer_reviews.text: straps no good leaks blue dye down my back .allways having to pump and spray head stopping up on a grain of sand.threw away ordered a 8gal electr. sprayer for my ATV.would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN  S  JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last August used it twice and it already stopped holding pressure. The seal at the bottom continues to fall off and the chemicals inside run down your legs and waste the almost $200 fertilizer I had in it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: We bought this sprayer to apply paint where our paint sprayer couldn't reach. It works great and shoots as far as 25 ft as described in the listing. If you need it to spray farther, simply look at the weather forecast and find a time when the wind will help push the spray where you want it to go. This is a simple sturdy machine that doesn't require electricity or maintenance other than a rinse when you are done. I like the exercise from working the hand pump and the absence of loud machine noises. Definitely glad we got it.
customer_reviews.author: Hausfräulein

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these for the last 10 years. it finally gave up the ghost so I bought a new one. great workmanship. some assembly required but simple to do. only need a screwdriver and a wrench. Works perfectly. My father in law uses these with his lawn business. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked well once
customer_reviews.text: I used this twice and it broke on the second use. I was using it to spray a mixture of castor oil and detergent on the grass to deter moles and I got through 2 gallons, and when I went to refill it, the hand pump wouldn't pressurize the tank, making the unit worthless. I got the number from Amazon for the Solo customer support (800-919-8590) and called it but it said the number is not in service! Would definitively avoid buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: James J.

customer_reviews.title: Better ones out there for a little more.
customer_reviews.text: • As others have pointed out, the straps are a joke. You'll never be able to keep them untangled or consistently connected to the sprayer. • After about a year the wand connections leaked. • I replaced the wand but the wand depressurizing mechanism would not engage--misaligned plastic. • Shortly after that, the bottom of the tank leaked. In any case I've moved on to a no-leak Smith sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: T. French

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer for pond chemical application
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to apply Algaecide on our .5 acre pond. With the included jet nozzle I can spray a stream out to 25-30'. It is also strong enough to break the surface tension and apply to problems under water as well. I did a lot of research and found this to be the backpack sprayer with the longest reach of 25-30'. I plan on getting the 5' extension to add length as well as being able to apply under the surface easier.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: Used 3 times & it stopped pumping. Customer service number not working so I don't know how to get help or replacement. I bought this for my husband's Father's day gift this year. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend buying this backpack sprayer. The straps are very poor quality, there was sharp plastic left on the tank from the molding process that needed to be trimmed off. It was missing an O ring on the sprayer handle the hose connection on the bottom of the tank leaked. After repairing these things it would not pump up and build pressure. I never leave reviews but this was such poor quality, I felt I had too.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Boy

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Works well. It has the 4 gallon mark on it, but it isn't marked from 0 to 4 gallons except dashes. It is fine though.
customer_reviews.author: D. Juniper

customer_reviews.title: Long term quality suffers
customer_reviews.text: After several months of use the bolts connecting the pump handle to the pump backed out and became disconnected. Was difficult to repair with a full tank. Used thread lock to assemble and hope it stays together. A simple fix really, but annoying. Have not experienced any leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder strap inadequate
customer_reviews.text: The shoulder strap is thin and uncomfortable with tank full. Started using only 1 gallon fill but strap clamp keeps coming off. This tank does not have a handle which makes it difficult to handle the spray lever is permanent in one position which makes storage difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Coach

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have four of these Solos sprayers for various gardening needs. Take care of them after each use (rinse them out) and they'll last forever. Easy and comfortable to use. I also recommend getting the Solo extention tube which will make spraying so much easier on your back since you'll have a much longer reach.
customer_reviews.author: dogboy

customer_reviews.title: It works fine for me that way
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sprayer so I could spray the eaves of my house with insecticide to keep the mud dauber wasps from building nests there I only put two gallons in it and spray at a lower pressure. It works fine for me that way. I, too do not like the straps and pins. Straps keep sliding off my shoulders. l will fashion a cross-strap to hold them together and that will keep them on my shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Dowell

customer_reviews.title: Remember to clean it each time it is used
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of use and for a hand pump the pressure it has. It is versatile and easy to clean. The instructions and parts list are a little confusing but got through it. It does seem that it will last with proper care and maintenance
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Davis

customer_reviews.title: Looks to be perfect just a heads up, I had to return
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for compost tea spraying. I was disappointed to learn (luckly before using) that you should absolutely not use this model for spraying compost tea as it definitely counts as a 'wettable powder'. This model says specifically to not use this model for wettable powders and if you do to literally open it up completely and clean and re-grease it every time. Go for a diaphram model like the 475 if you want to spray wettable powders. Otherwise, these great way to take your gardening to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: Ross McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Obviously no “Quality Controls” by SOLO!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! Opened box, removed the sprayer, followed assembly instructions added a gallon of water to the sprayer tank to practice sprayer operations. Pumped handle and a leak developed at the pump piston. EXTREMELY Poor quality. You can plainly see the piston is misaligned, great quality control SOLO! On another note the decal stickers on the tank were misaligned and had air bubbles, plastic debris under the decals. There was obviously no QUALITY CONTROL done before shoving this sprayer in the box. VERY DISAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.author: George Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Leaking wand
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to allow me to water in remote areas when planting food plots. After a weekend worth of use, the wand continues to leak even on the locked position. Of course the return period just expired 4 days ago and I am left with a faulty product. With zero pressure, the leak allowed almost two gallons of water of escape through the wand. The only way I can stop the leaking at this point is to elevate the wand with the end pointing up or purge the tank dry.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Keep deer out of your garden
customer_reviews.text: What a difference it makes to be able to spray one's whole garden with Deer Out carrying the supply comfortably on one's back! Would recommend not carrying more than 1 gallon of liquid at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Judi

customer_reviews.title: Good sprayer then they include all the parts
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn't have one of the bolts necessary for the pump handle. So had to run to the hardware store, get a bolt, install it, and over an hour later, I can finally start working. Stuff like that frustrates me to no end. And before someone says "it probably fell out of the box". Well, the associated washer didn't, so Plus side is the fan spray nozzle shoots a very wide pattern, and makes short work of any project
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Buy this if you apply flea and tick on the lawn more than one time a year ! This will save you time and money as you don’t have to hire a professional! I was in the lawn care industry and I had no issues with these sprayers !
customer_reviews.author: TDH

customer_reviews.title: Quit working the 2nd time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: Used it the first time with no issues, used it again a few weeks later and it quit halfway through spraying. Naturally I was a week past the return window. I now have an $80.00 paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: DKRitter

customer_reviews.title: Repaired twice already
customer_reviews.text: My husband has fixed this sprayer twice. Leaked at first use - fixed that. Then the arm broke. He had to take one off his old sprayer to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Tamorah B

customer_reviews.title: Cuts weed killing time in half.
customer_reviews.text: The product is everything advertised. Once you adjust the shoulder straps it is very easy to walk and spray. The hand pump is easy to use while working without having to take sprayer off. I recommend it to anyone who has a lot of weeds to kill.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Woodard

customer_reviews.title: A dissapointment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade for a garden sprayer for a higher volume application. One of the straps broke right away. The cap developed a leak soon after. Now the pump mechanism is broken and won't pump. The biggest disappointment was the pump itself. It can't keep up with the sprayer so you have to pump it up, spray, pump it up again and so on. I am back to using the hand sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Hector R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate. Great for weeds over a large area.
customer_reviews.text: I mixed 30% vinegar with a small amount of salt and dish soap. The sprayer operates easily once you have it full and on your back. Quality construction -- the parts are nicely made, and it's well assembled. I run water through it after use; I'm sure the vinegar-salt solution is corrosive, but so far no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and works great. Back straps sould be a little wider and heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Don Terry Luton

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I only used this sprayer 3 times. Now it wont pressurize when its pumped and it leaked insecticide down my back. I have a 5 gal Redmax Sprayer that I have been using for 10 years. No Problems. I wanted to try something a little less Bulky so I tried the SOLO because you see the professional landscapers using them. I believe if I had had a chance to use it longer I would have some concern with the plastic strap clips, looks like I'll never know.
customer_reviews.author: James Jones

customer_reviews.title: It's the only backpack sprayer I buy.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this model for over ten years. The first failed because someone forgot to rinse it out after applying Prowl+glyphosate, and another someone tried to fix it and didn't know what he was doing. I wouldn't buy any other.
customer_reviews.author: dr.mae

customer_reviews.title: The straps on this backpacked can never fit a full ...
customer_reviews.text: The straps on this backpacked can never fit a full grown man . I am six feet 6 260lbs , couldn't even get an arm in this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Shrimp soup

customer_reviews.title: Using as acrylic sealer applicator? - Please read.
customer_reviews.text: Application: Staining and sealing concrete floor Result: Staining - worked perfect Sealing - big trouble - We had sealer left in the hose overnight to make touchups in the morning, by the morning the hose had turned to mush so.... If you are going to use this for this type of application, make sure you thuroughly flush out or just replace the nylon hose prior to use with a teflon hose - other than that worked perfect. I had to throw out entire unit after using - I chalk this up to the "unique" application we were using it for - will buy another and retrofit hose as described.
customer_reviews.author: Linemods

customer_reviews.title: Pick a more reliable brand
customer_reviews.text: They forgot the handle for the pump. It really isnt worth your time, I tried calling the company and it was a hassle getting a hold. Stay away from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: alejandro ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Seems like quality control could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Top of sprayer where lid screws on is warped. Lid will screw down but if not careful it will be cross threaded and leak out top with full tank, Works great but for the price you shouldn't have them ship you something that obviously wasn't checked by QC before packing.
customer_reviews.author: Boots918

customer_reviews.title: It works but you might not get a pump lever
customer_reviews.text: The backpack sprayer works well mine didnt come with the pumplever so i had to remove it off another sprayer to get it to work
customer_reviews.author: Roberto R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic sprayer. The volume markings are easy to see and make it easy when mixing. It would be nice if it came with more spraying heads, but not a deal breaker. A must for those who garden regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: The twisting of the handle for storage
customer_reviews.text: I like the sprayer but I wish I would have pay attention in buying the one I already have the handle of this one does not fold in and there is no handle on top of the sprayer for caring when not on your back.
customer_reviews.author: kevin j koskie

customer_reviews.title: Good for most applications
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to spray fence line and beds for weeds which this unit will do. Easy to set up and use. Wish I had gone the few extra dollars to get one that is bleach compliant. This one is not for use with caustic agents. That is why a 4. But for spraying weed killer, works great!
customer_reviews.author: Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have sprayed about 20 gallons through mine so far it works great and comfortable. The only thing I dislike is you always have some left in tank that you can't use.
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular Quality. Great spray volume!
customer_reviews.text: A reminder of why I’m never disappointed when I buy a product made In the U.S. great quality, great spray volume. You never have to go back and forth. One pass is sufficient. Highly recommended. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rescue, CA

customer_reviews.title: MUCH better
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer is far superior to my rinky dink sprayers of the past. Easy assembly, good stream, convenient back pack frees up both hands. Not heavy at all on the back and I'm small
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and a quality product. This is a significant upgrade for a Greenwood 4 gal backpack sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: MARALT

customer_reviews.title: The straps on this sprayer SUCK!
customer_reviews.text: The sprayer itself is fine, but the straps are absolute garbage. I have wide shoulders and the sprayer kept wanting to slip off my back. Very frustrating. I took the harness straps off a previous Costco bought Solo and replaced the cheap straps on the new unit. Solo needs to improve the stock straps or supply the harness type with all units, not make them an expensive option.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. DeMuri

customer_reviews.title: Great unit but the furnished harness is a joke.
customer_reviews.text: Come on Solo, include a decent harness with a $100+ unit. Paying another $36 for a "shoulder saver" harness is not a good thing. Why any company would ship a unit that weighs in at 40 pounds loaded, would "include" a 1" wide waist to shoulder blade harness as adequate baffles me. A back pack this heavy (and otherwise this good) merits a harness that wraps around the waist to take most of the weight. Shame on you for selling a should saver (which you tried to wreck) for extra money.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carter

customer_reviews.title: I guess it works fine, the handle sticks out quite a ways
customer_reviews.text: I guess it works fine, the handle sticks out quite a ways, which it makes it impossible to store, because you can't fold it up. The straps are disappointing. The wand is hard to reach again if you set it down (hope you have very long arms). And it leaks weed killer onto my shoulders. Kind of disappointed with it for the price. My advice is to spend a little more and get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sprayer, I like the fact that you can replace all the o rings and there like new I get several seasons of use out of these
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: It does work..
customer_reviews.text: The handle seems very loose. It does work well, but handle just seems cheap.. I have owed several over my 15+ years in pest/lawn business.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: great sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: I use this backpack sprayer primarily for weed control along fence rows and around buildings. It is performing exceptionally well. No complaints or concerns. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: stonecold

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: We like the large-volume capacity and enjoy using this for yard treatments.
customer_reviews.author: s

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this to replace my old model which gave up ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace my old model which gave up after many years of service. I am looking forward to this sprayer lasting as long as my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris F

customer_reviews.title: pump failed!
customer_reviews.text: I got this on Amazon last October use only three times and now it seems that the pump lever and something inside separated and will not pump up. I can't get a hold of the dealer and i just want a credit for this purchase. Amazon please get back to me! Thank you, Cliff
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This tank has made my spraying job a lot easier. Some reviewers state their sprayer leaks. No leaking issues with my sprayer, it works as it should. Straps are smaller than pictured but still not too bad to carry around. This little guy is a great value. Would have given it 5 stars if straps had more padding.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. I have three. This unit does not operate. Simply does not work. It would have been a Chalenge to return so it is still sitting in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Cow paddy daddy

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Junk, lasted less than 3 hours. My first backpack was a solo in the 80s made in Germany and lasted 15 years
customer_reviews.author: Kpop

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Had an old SOLO and it was time to update....last one was 20 yrs old.....still worked till I forgot to empty and stuff gelled up and ruined it....hope new one last as long
customer_reviews.author: Tony Miller

customer_reviews.title: Bolts attached to product may have dropped off into box.
customer_reviews.text: Initially I thought a bolt n nut was missing ... my error. One bolt was attached and one loose in the box. I had already started return as a result; same evening I googled other sprayers similar and found some with handles and nice backstraps, so I continued my return, however I have no complaints about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Assata D. Sherrill

customer_reviews.title: This model is cumbersome and allows no handle settings
customer_reviews.text: I have used this sprayer 4-times and now the bladder does not work not building pressure to work the pump. This is the worse sprayer ever to be used I my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customercc

customer_reviews.title: I have used many sprayers over 30 years and am pleased with the performance this backpack sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional in the Landscape Maintenance field. I have used many sprayers over 30 years and am pleased with the performance this backpack sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Made the mistake of rebuilding a Solo... ...
customer_reviews.text: Made the mistake of rebuilding a Solo.....royal pain in the backside, plus over half the cost of new for the parts. This time ( many years life out of these), bought new.
customer_reviews.author: Tn_Andy

customer_reviews.title: False description
customer_reviews.text: The description calls out the ability to set the spray pressure to different maximums, which is why I chose this model. This sprayer DOES NOT have that feature. Completely incorrect advertising, which lead me to be quite disappointed with this sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: TSwarr

customer_reviews.title: Have three ofmthese sprayers, on is over 10'yrs old
customer_reviews.text: Have three of these sprayers. I am 5.2 so they fit nicely and i can carry half full of solution. I use solo because of easemofmuse and availability of replacement parts. One sprayer is 10 yrs old still going. Replace,ents have been very small,oarts which i manged to loose..
customer_reviews.author: Toni C James

customer_reviews.title: Nice sprayer for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble and use. The additional backpack system makes it so comfortable to carry.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Pump is junk
customer_reviews.text: This is junk i would not purchase this item after only 3 uses the hand pump is no longer pressurizing and is stiff and feels like its going to break as i try to pump it. Ive already bent the handle from this. I would spend my money on a battery operated one instead
customer_reviews.author: Jose y lesem

customer_reviews.title: Very unhappy with this product
customer_reviews.text: unit leaks so bad not able to use it quite a mess very unhappy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Older one was better
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was like the older model with handle to pick it up and hold the wand
customer_reviews.author: Guess

customer_reviews.title: Great professional sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: Great sprayer. Easy to put together. Comes with a few spray tips so can change to get the desired spray needed for the job. Easy to use. Fill, pump. spray. Straps are padded and work well. Can get a lot sprayed before having to refill with 4 gal capacity.
customer_reviews.author: B.A.D. 2500

customer_reviews.title: good sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I like the straps better on my old one but its a good sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: G. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Very good measuring markers on tank. Easy adjustable spray novel.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I used this product 3 times and now it leaks all over me. The customer service number they have is no longer valid. So now I have a useless piece of plastic. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Hunsaker

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Leaked copper spray down the back of my legs. Was missing a part. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: A. H.

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: It’s great other than the threading on the cap is slightly off making it difficult to close.
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Low quality straps
customer_reviews.text: Good product exactly what I expected, but i dont like the quality of the straps
customer_reviews.author: bitbyanangel

customer_reviews.title: Sprays well but fragile
customer_reviews.text: This is the piston model, which is more durable than the diaphragm model, but it is still not very durable. The hose fillings have cracked and the O-rings have all split at one time or another. However, it is comfortable to wear and the spray works well, though it will not reach very high.
customer_reviews.author: Dion J. King

customer_reviews.title: No Handle
customer_reviews.text: Ordered by mistake ....4 gallon sprayers need a handle if you want to agitate spaying mixtures
customer_reviews.author: David Halperin

customer_reviews.title: I have used these before with no problem, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these before with no problem, but this one the top of the holding tank where the 4.5" cap threads on is not flush and has a dip in it thus allowing it to leak when walking around.
customer_reviews.author: searay76

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: Works like it’s supposed to. I like the different tips and that it’s 4 gallons.
customer_reviews.author: DougMart

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good sprayer. The only issue is that the bottom clips that hold the shoulder straps fall off easily and without warning. I taped mine with duct tape.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and as described. Would recommend seller. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sprayer for fences
customer_reviews.text: Good product at a good price. I used this to spray Olympic Toner on my fence. It's work lugging four gallongs on one's back, but it did the job. Be sure to clean per the instructions so it will be ready the next time that you need it. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Paul in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Leaked from the start! Goes right down the back side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very much worth it
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of trying to replace parts in my old sprayers. So instead I sprung for a complete new one. It made a great difference.
customer_reviews.author: r

customer_reviews.title: Solo products are good
customer_reviews.text: best price around by far but leaked and returning for another one being sent. leaked and got chemical on my lower back
customer_reviews.author: John H. Alford Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good medium use sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I've used my Solo twice spraying a 26 acre field for thistle and hawkweed. Everything worked fine and at this point I'm pleased with my purchase. On the negative side, the straps aren't the most comfortable and they do have a tendency to slip off my shoulder from time to time. I think the harness upgrade would erase this problem. All in all, for the price it works just fine for my application.
customer_reviews.author: gordinski

customer_reviews.title: You Will Dribble
customer_reviews.text: It works ok, but every single one of these I've used (a dozen or more, at a prairie restoration operation) always has a leaky sprayer valve. Evrery. Single. One. You will always be dribbling fluid from the wand, the valve always gets fouled and will never fully shut off. If you like disassebling and cleaning a sprayer valve with poison liquids all over your hands, this sprayer is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Works great !!! I use mine for work doing weed control . My only complaint is that the pump handle is too long , which makes it very difficult to store in my truck . I have to use the bed of my truck which is also difficult because there is a 200 gallon spray rig back there
customer_reviews.author: Brad Boatright

customer_reviews.title: This one made spraying easy. A professional landscaper recommended this
customer_reviews.text: This one made spraying easy. A professional landscaper recommended this, and I don't regret it. I don't have to stop and pump it up every few minutes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pass on the Solo!
customer_reviews.text: This will leak at the house and ring attachment. Also, the straps are poor of quality and function. Looking for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Zachmcg33

customer_reviews.title: Great all purpose sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for two years now and use it for my 2 acre vegetable plot. I hope it lasts me another year. Very pleased with quality and price. It is my third solo sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Leah F,

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The manufacture made modifications to the design that made what was a very durable and useful product into a perfect product.
customer_reviews.author: cindy hoovler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This item made short work of a job that used to take hours with a 2 gallon hand sprayer
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Solo knock-off
customer_reviews.text: What a rip. The one I received is a Solo knock-off. Leaks like crazy. Every fastener was loose and still leaks after tightening. If It doesn't have the flag on it send it back. Ended up buying one from Home Depot for $75.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: I have two and love them.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second backpack sprayer from Solo. I have labeled one for herbicides and the other for pesticides. They are easy to use, clean and maintain. The tank holds so much that I can mix just what I need for the project and not have to refill. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: warren alan jones

customer_reviews.title: After a few uses the sprayer wan't stop spraying completely ...
customer_reviews.text: After a few uses the sprayer wan't stop spraying completely once pressurized. It drips spray where I don't want it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Not much to say. I have used one for ...
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. I have used one for twenty years and it was time to replace. It is the gold standard of sprayers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Solo 425 4-Gallon Professional Piston Backpack Sprayer, Wide Pressure Range up to 90 psi
product_meta.description:
Built for comfort. Built for convenience. Built to last. SOLO sprayers are professional grade, triple test inspected and made in the USA. The SOLO 425, with a connecting rod-actuated piston pump, can produce a wide pressure range of up to 90 psi and is capable of performing virtually every spraying task. With a proven piston pump, you will be reliably equipped for applying spray liquid or insecticides in your garden. A low number of wearing parts and sturdy technology ensure a long service life and minimum maintenance. The large filling aperture for convenient filling of the tank and smooth-running pump make spraying pleasant work. The ergonomic design contours to your back for greater comfort.

AMAZON.COM
The Solo manual 4-gallon 60 psi high-pressure backpack sprayer features an ultraviolet resistant tank, felt padded polyester straps, a heavy duty pressure cylinder and reversible pump lever. The high pressure backpack sprayer is made of all high-grade, corrosion resistant plastic, with no metal or rubber parts made vulnerable to chemicals. The chemical backpack applicator includes a connecting rod actuated piston pump to produce a wide pressure range up to 60 psi, 4-foot high pressure hose, a spray tube of 55 cm, and can carry up to 12 pounds. With its easy operating shut off valve, durable plastic parts, and 4-1/4-inch opening, it can handle disinfectants, fertilizers, herbicides, and pest control products for efficient tree, shrub, and plant protection. This tool is backed by a 1-year limited manufacturer's warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Since its introduction to the US market in 1964, Solo's popular 425 backpack sprayer has been the standard by which all backpack sprayers are measured. High-density polyethylene tank with ultra-violet inhibitors allows for unmatched durability and ultra-violet protection. Large 4.25-Inch opening for easy filling and cleaning. Shut-off valve and wand with an overall length of 28 inches for hard-to-reach places. 4-foot high-pressure hose. With its connecting rod-activated piston pump, the 425 is capable of producing a wide pressure range of up to 90-psi, and is capable of performing virtually every spraying task. Easily and effectively handles disinfectants, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, and formulations for tree, shrub and plant protection and wood and concrete finishing and treatments. Solo backpacks are constructed of high density polyethylene and other chemical resistant materials. A 1-year warranty is provided. Given proper maintenance, the sprayer should last for millions of pumps and many years of use. Each Solo sprayer is equipped with an adjustable, flat spray, hollow cone and jet stream nozzle to accommodate virtually every spraying need. Padded straps with pull tabs make adjustments quick and easy. Built-in strainers, screens and filters help keep debris out of nozzles. Pressure can be regulated to 15, 30 , 45 or 60 psi by means of a built-in pressure regulating valve. Unbreakable wand prevents damage common to brass and brittle plastic wands. Viton seals, gaskets and O-rings provide excellent chemical resistance and durability.

See more
feature_bullets: Easily spray liquid disinfectants, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides with Solo's high-performance piston pump for tree, shrub and plant protection
Solo’s 425 backpack sprayer includes a 28-inch unbreakable wand that securely connects to a 48-inch nylon-reinforced high-pressure hose for an extended reach
Four easily changeable commercial-grade spraying nozzles-Plastic Adjustable, Fan Spray, Hollow Cone, Jet Stream nozzle and is TeeJet compatible
Designed with a commercial shut-off valve that securely locks in either the on or off position to minimize user fatigue, the pump handle is interchangeable for left or right-hand operation
Solo's rugged metal frame with an extra-large tank opening makes it easy to fill and clean quickly
Thoughtfully designed with Viton seals placed in key locations to ensure long service and durability
